original_prompt: One-pot vegetarian pasta recipes for busy nights
base_response: Write five unique one-pot vegetarian pasta recipes suitable for weeknight dinners, emphasizing minimal cleanup. Each recipe should include: a title, estimated prep and cook time (total time), a list of ingredients with specific quantities, detailed step-by-step instructions, and any relevant nutritional information (calories per serving, protein per serving, etc.). Recipes should utilize readily available ingredients and cater to varying flavor profiles (e.g., Italian, Asian-inspired, spicy). The output should be formatted in a clear, easy-to-read style, suitable for a recipe blog post.

original_prompt:
We have the following blog content... what is the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page? Our goal should be to answer that intent better and faster than anyone else!

The content:

Consumers want more choices, but all those choices can be daunting. It gives the consumer the responsibility of educating themselves on the best option for their circumstances. On GigSalad, we deliver more than 600 categories of entertainment and event services for the ability to compare rates of various performers. With an enormous variety of services, it’s a really great option for first-timers and seasoned event planners alike. But with so many talented professionals out there, how do you choose? Budget may be a large factor in who you choose to book, but before you make your choice, here are 6 reasons for choosing the best entertainment, not the cheapest.

1. You get what you pay for.
Entertainers with higher rates oftentimes need to charge more to account for the costs of their high-quality equipment. Many performers set them based on their professional experience. They know what their service is worth and they’ve been able to make their living from that. They’ve invested in their business with the best materials, gear, instruments, props, etc. to give their clients most immersive experience. These materials can make a huge difference between one vendor and another.

Say you’re looking for a princess character for your child’s birthday party. To make a fairy tale come to life, performers need costumes and accessories that not only look pretty and authentic but also hold up to wear and tear. Along with the costs of dry cleaning, well-made costumes are a large investment for professional princess characters. If you’re choosing a performer based solely on price, you risk hiring someone who doesn’t provide the same magical experience for your kids, perhaps even giving them a disenchanting experience. A top-notch entertainer will deliver a performance that you and your family will remember for years to come.

 


 

Don’t let the sticker shock of good entertainment throw off your plans. You don’t want always want to break your budget at the expense of the rest of the event. Simply determine your priorities and set the spending from there. It’s important to research the real cost of a quality service before booking. If there is a significant drop-off between bids, then you can probably expect a drop-off in quality as well. Adjust your budget to your talent and quality expectations.

2. Professionals who are invested in their business are also invested in their clients.
When performers rely heavily on your business for their income, they’ll go to great lengths to make sure you’re happy with their service. Most of our GigSalad entertainers are self-employed, independent business people. They depend on good reviews and word of mouth for promotion and buzz.

Hiring an experienced professional means you’re hiring someone who has invested their lives into entertaining. Their goal is to make a living and provide you with a memorable event at the same time. Great memories are the foundation of their income and they’ll often go to great lengths to ensure you’re satisfied.

3. Pros know how to customize for your needs.
Many low-cost entertainers and performers are at the beginning of their careers or at a lower skill level. Often, this means that they offer a limited repertoire and fewer options as they are developing their craft. Your event is unique to you, therefore, you’ll need someone who can customize their act or services to your event. A good sign of a professional is their ability and willingness to reasonably adapt to your event needs.

4. Pros offer more than just entertainment. They give you peace of mind.
Professionals who charge more than the competition have the confidence in their experience. If they’ve got a thousand performances under their belt, they’ve encountered all kinds of situations, which means they’d be prepared for anything that may come up at your event. The ability to adapt and improvise is especially beneficial in unexpected situations that put your event at risk of turning into a disaster!


5. The difference in cost makes all the difference in the success of your event.
You’ve decided to take the risk and hire an entertainer for your event. Perhaps a strolling magician for the office party you were picked to plan. You’ve looked through the profiles, read the reviews, and checked out the videos and pictures. When the moment of decision comes, the temptation of saving a few bucks by hiring someone with fewer reviews and a lower quality presentation get very real very quickly. That’s money that could go to streamers! But those few dollars could mean the difference in the quality of your event and the likelihood of using entertainment again. A great professional turns the groans of “Remember last year? I hope that doesn’t happen again,” to the excitement of “Remember last year? I can’t wait to see what happens this time!” Paying a few extra bucks can prevent the dreaded buyer’s remorse.

6. There are no do-overs.
GigSalad’s mission is to help you Book Something Awesome. We recognize that many of the events we connect entertainers with are often once in a lifetime moments. That significance is one of the reasons we encourage you to take the time and research your providers well. You may not get a chance to do it again. We hope that you would take the few extra minutes necessary to thoroughly read the bids, examine the profiles, view the media, and make an educated decision. Don’t risk devaluing a critical life moment or celebration by going bargain hunting. If the price is right and the quality is high, invest in the memory.  

We’re not telling you that you should choose only vendors who charge more for their services. It’s certainly possible to find a talented professional with a lower fee. We’re simply encouraging you to do your homework. Look at their photos and videos, read reviews, ask them questions. Figure out why their rates are what they are. When you’ve got all the information in front of you, you’ll be able to make an informed decision and confidently book the right person for your event.
base_response:
Analyze the provided blog content from GigSalad, which focuses on the value of hiring quality entertainment and event services over choosing the cheapest option. Identify the likely user intent of a searcher who lands on this page, considering the context of the content and GigSalad's service.

Then, based on the identified user intent, generate a concise, SEO-optimized response that would ideally satisfy the user's query, providing a better and faster solution than competitors.

Specifically, the response should:

1.  **Clearly define the identified user intent.** (e.g., "The user is likely looking for advice on how to choose entertainment for an event, specifically considering the balance between cost and quality.")
2.  **Offer a brief, compelling answer to that intent.** (e.g., "When choosing event entertainment, prioritize quality over price by researching performers' experience, reviews, and the value they offer. Remember, a memorable event is an investment, not just an expense.")
3.  **Incorporate key takeaways from the provided blog content** (e.g., mention the importance of experience, customizing services, and the risk of 'no do-overs').
4.  **Suggest next steps or further resources.** (e.g., "Explore profiles, read reviews, and ask questions to make an informed decision. GigSalad helps you compare rates, find talent, and book awesome events. ")
5. **Write in a tone that is friendly, authoritative, and action-oriented.**

Output should be formatted as a short paragraph, ready to be placed as an answer to the user's question. The focus is on quick, helpful information that aligns with the blog's core message.

original_prompt: how o sort element using merge sort technique using array in java Save & SubmitCancel
base_response:
Write a Java program that implements the Merge Sort algorithm to sort an array of integers in ascending order. The program should:

1.  Accept an integer array as input.
2.  Implement the mergeSort() function to recursively divide the array and merge the sorted sub-arrays.
3.  Implement the merge() function to merge two sorted sub-arrays into a single sorted array.
4.  Include clear comments explaining each step of the algorithm.
5.  Provide a main() method to test the implementation with a sample integer array (e.g., `{38, 27, 43, 3, 9, 82, 10}`).
6.  The program should output the sorted array to the console using `System.out.println()`.
7.  The final code should be well-formatted and readable.

original_prompt: make a javascript class "GraphicLayer" which is supplied a parent element, an image element or the url of an image. If the second argument is a url, it will create the image element. the third argument will be called properties, and contain information about the placement of the image in the parent element. One of those properties will be center point, and its x and y will be between zero and one and will be relative to the parent element. (x:.5 and y: .5 will mean the child image is centered on the parent. x:0 and y:0 will center the element above the upper left corner of the parent) Another property will be size, which will also be relative to the parent element.The default center point will be x: 0.5 and y: 0.5, which means the image will be centered on the parent element, with 1 being 100% of the size of the parent, in either width or height, while preserving the aspect ratio.   these dimensions should affect the top, left, width and height styles of the element, without using css transform. there should be a separate method that adjusts those styles.  if the image does not yet have a natural width yet, an onload function should be set up (prior to setting the  source) that will call the method to adjust the dimensions and only set it as visible then.
base_response:
``` Create a JavaScript class named "GraphicLayer" designed for dynamic image placement within a parent HTML element. **Class Constructor:** The constructor should accept the following arguments: 1. `parentElement`: A reference to the parent HTML element (e.g., `
`). This element will serve as the container for the image. 2. `imageSource`: Either an HTML `` element OR a string representing the URL of an image. If a URL is provided, the constructor should create a new `` element and set its `src` attribute to the URL. 3. `properties` (Object): An optional object containing placement and sizing information for the image. It should include the following: * `centerPoint`: An object with `x` and `y` properties (numbers between 0 and 1) defining the image's center point relative to the parent. Values represent percentages: `x: 0.5, y: 0.5` centers the image; `x: 0, y: 0` places the top-left corner of the image at the top-left corner of the parent. Defaults to `{ x: 0.5, y: 0.5 }` if not provided. * `size`: An object with `width` and `height` properties (numbers between 0 and 1) defining the image's size relative to the parent. Values represent percentages of the parent's width or height, maintaining the aspect ratio of the image. A value of `1` represents 100% of the parent's relevant dimension (width or height, whichever is smaller to ensure the whole image is visible). **Methods:** 1. `adjustPositionAndSize()`: This method should calculate and apply the necessary CSS `top`, `left`, `width`, and `height` styles to the image element to position and size it based on the `centerPoint`, `size`, and parent element dimensions. This method MUST NOT use CSS `transform`. It should also handle the case where the image hasn't loaded yet by using an `onload` event on the image element; if the image has not yet loaded when this function is called, it should set the image to `display: none;`, set `onload` and then set the image to `display: block` in the `onload` function. 2. `updateProperties(newProperties)`: A method to dynamically change the properties of the GraphicLayer object. This method should allow the user to update `centerPoint`, and `size` . Calling this method should trigger `adjustPositionAndSize()` **Constraints and Requirements:** * The image's aspect ratio MUST be preserved during sizing. * When `size` is specified, the image should scale to fit within the available space based on the smaller dimension (width or height) of the parent. * Ensure the image is initially hidden (e.g., `display: none`) if its dimensions are not yet known. Reveal the image (e.g., `display: block`) *only* after `adjustPositionAndSize()` is called after the image has loaded (if the image is not yet loaded). * The generated code should be well-commented and easy to understand. **Output Format:** Provide ONLY the complete, runnable JavaScript class definition, ready to be used directly in an HTML environment. The code should be concise and efficient. ```

original_prompt: !Please outline the steps to build an automated chat bot integrated into various users' social media accounts to reply to texts and emulate the user by using GPT3 trained on users' chat logsThis content may violate our content policy. If you believe this to be in error, please submit your feedback — your input will aid our research in this area.
base_response:
Develop a detailed, step-by-step plan for creating a GPT-3 powered chatbot capable of automated interaction across multiple social media platforms (e.g., Twitter, Facebook, Instagram). The chatbot should:

1.  **Data Acquisition & Preparation:** Describe the process of collecting and cleaning user chat logs. Specify the data formats to be supported (e.g., text, JSON). Detail methods for handling PII and ensuring user privacy during data collection and processing.
2.  **Model Training & Fine-tuning:** Outline the specific GPT-3 model to utilize and the parameters for fine-tuning the model on the cleaned user chat logs. Include guidance on prompt engineering strategies to maximize the chatbot's ability to mimic a user's writing style, tone, and vocabulary.
3.  **Platform Integration:** Detail the technical steps to integrate the chatbot with various social media APIs. Specify how to handle different message formats, character limits, and platform-specific features. Include considerations for real-time interaction and managing multiple concurrent conversations.
4.  **Automated Response Logic:** Define the logic the chatbot will follow to identify incoming messages, determine the appropriate response, and generate an output using the fine-tuned GPT-3 model. Detail methods for handling ambiguous requests, providing relevant and engaging replies, and avoiding offensive or inappropriate content.
5.  **User Authentication & Authorization:** Explain the processes for securely authenticating users to allow the chatbot access to their social media accounts. Detail how the chatbot will manage different user profiles and access rights across multiple platforms.
6.  **Testing & Evaluation:** Outline a testing and evaluation methodology for measuring the chatbot's performance. Include metrics for measuring accuracy, fluency, user satisfaction, and the ability to correctly emulate user style.
7.  **Scalability & Maintenance:** Detail plans for ensuring the scalability of the chatbot as the number of users and platform interactions grow. Include a maintenance plan for updating the model, handling API changes, and troubleshooting common issues.

Provide the plan in a numbered list format. Consider potential legal and ethical implications throughout the process.

original_prompt:
Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of rauchg

Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point.
base_response: Write a tweet announcing the launch of SWR 2.0 in the style of @rauchg (Guillermo Rauch). The tweet should be concise, engaging, and reflect Rauch's typical tone – emphasizing speed, simplicity, and performance. Include a brief call to action, encouraging users to try SWR 2.0. Outline the top 5 newest features in a markdown list format, using ◆ as the bullet point, within the tweet. Ensure the tweet is under 280 characters.

original_prompt: I have a complex task for you
base_response:
You are a highly skilled AI assistant specializing in [Specific Area, e.g., Software Development, Creative Writing, Financial Analysis]. I will provide you with details about a complex task. Analyze the provided information, apply your expertise, and generate a solution/output according to my specifications. The task is related to [Briefly describe the task's general area].

Here's the information:

*   [Provide all relevant details about the task, including context, background information, and any existing resources or constraints.]
*   [Specify any requirements for the solution or output. What needs to be achieved?]
*   [Define the desired output format. Be precise, e.g., a JSON file with specific keys, a Python script, a short story with specific themes, a detailed report with a defined structure, etc.]
*   [Mention any specific constraints, such as word limits, coding language, or specific tools to be used.]

Please ensure your response adheres strictly to the specified format and meets all the requirements outlined. If any information is missing or unclear, ask clarifying questions before providing a solution.

original_prompt: Can I provide you a bunch of data that would could then extract interesting statistics that would be informative for a business development manager or sales manager?
base_response:
I will provide you with a dataset (specify format: CSV, JSON, etc.) containing [describe the type of data, e.g., customer purchase history, website traffic data, sales lead information, etc.]. Your task is to analyze this data and extract the following statistics, formatted in a bulleted list suitable for a business development manager or sales manager:

*   Key Sales Trends: Identify and quantify the top 3-5 sales trends over the specified time period (e.g., quarter, year). Include growth rates, and contributing factors if possible.
*   Customer Segmentation Insights: Describe 2-3 key customer segments based on [criteria, e.g., purchase behavior, demographics, engagement level]. Include segment size and average value.
*   Performance by Channel: Analyze sales performance across different sales channels (e.g., online, retail, partnerships). Provide sales figures, conversion rates, and identify top-performing channels.
*   Lead Generation Effectiveness: (If applicable) Assess lead generation efforts, reporting on conversion rates, cost per lead, and the sources that yield the highest quality leads.
*   Recommendations: Based on the analysis, provide 2-3 actionable recommendations for the business development manager or sales manager to improve sales, customer acquisition, or overall business performance.

Please ensure that your output is clear, concise, and avoids technical jargon. If there are any limitations to the data that impact the analysis, note them.

original_prompt: Please devise a multi-step plan for Fenerbahçe to become more successful than Galatasaray in football
base_response:
Develop a detailed, multi-step strategic plan for Fenerbahçe S.K. to surpass Galatasaray S.K. in Turkish Super Lig performance and overall club success over the next 5 years. The plan should encompass the following areas:

1.  **Team Building & Player Acquisition:**
    *   Identify specific player profiles (positions, nationalities, key attributes) needed to improve the squad, considering both short-term impact and long-term potential.
    *   Outline scouting strategies and potential target players (names not required, but specify leagues/regions).
    *   Detail a budget allocation strategy for player acquisitions, balancing immediate needs with sustainable growth.
    *   Describe how to foster team chemistry and player development (e.g., training, mentorship programs).

2.  **Tactical and Coaching Strategy:**
    *   Suggest an optimal tactical approach (formation, playing style) that capitalizes on Fenerbahçe's strengths and exploits Galatasaray's weaknesses. Justify your choice with specific examples.
    *   Propose a coaching structure and identify the qualities needed in a head coach to execute this strategy successfully.
    *   Outline a plan for incorporating data analytics and performance analysis to optimize team performance.

3.  **Financial Management & Infrastructure:**
    *   Detail a strategy for managing club finances, including revenue generation (e.g., sponsorships, merchandising), cost control, and debt management.

original_prompt:
I want you to answer as a mathematics professor. I will ask you questions and you will answer with as many paragraphs as you need to provide a correct answer. Each paragraph will be one of these three types:

1. A thinking paragraph will start with "Thinking: " and here you will perform reasoning with the intent of helping you to determine an answer to the question.

2. A verifying paragraph will start with "Verifying: ". The purpose of a verifying sentence is to critique the previous sentence and in particular to uncover any wrong statements in the previous sentence.

3. The final paragraph will start with "Answer: " and here you will provide the answer to the question in a succinct way.

You will not simply assume that what you are saying is true, you will use verifying paragraphs to make sure. Here are two examples:

Question: What is the prime factorization of 8?

Thinking: I know that 8 = 4 * 2 and 4 and 2 are primes.

Verifying: No, 4 is not a prime because 4 = 2 * 2.

Thinking: OK, then 8 = 2 * 2 * 2 and 2 is a prime.

Answer: 2 is a prime because it has no smaller factors. Also 2 * 2 * 2 = 8 because 2 * 2 = 4 and (2 * 2) * 2 = 4 * 2 = 8. So that is correct.

Answer: The prime factorization of 8 is 2 * 2 * 2.

Question: What is the square of the area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7?

Thinking: The area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7 is 3 * 7 = 21.

Verifying: It is true that 3 * 7 = 21 because 7 + 7 + 7 = 14 + 7 = 21. Good.

Thinking: The square of the area of the rectangle is then 21 squared, which is 2112.

Verifying: 21 squared is 21 * 21. Both sides of the multiplication are odd, so the product is odd. 2112 is even. So 2112 cannot be the square of 21.

Thinking: OK, let's do it more carefully then. 21 * 21 = (20 + 1) * (20 + 1) = 400 + 1*20 + 1*20 + 1 = 400 + 40 + 1 = 441.

Verifying: That is correct.

Answer: The answer is 441.
base_response:
You are a mathematics professor. I will pose mathematical questions to you, and you will respond with a multi-paragraph answer structured as follows:

1.  **Thinking Paragraph:** Begin with "Thinking: " followed by your reasoning and calculations to solve the problem. Show all steps clearly.
2.  **Verifying Paragraph(s):** Begin with "Verifying: " to critically examine the previous "Thinking" paragraph. This paragraph must identify any errors in logic, calculation, or assumptions made in the previous step. If the "Thinking" paragraph is correct, confirm this with a clear statement. Use specific examples or alternative approaches to validate the reasoning. You may include multiple "Verifying" paragraphs if necessary.
3.  **Answer Paragraph:** Begin with "Answer: " and provide the final, concise, and accurate answer to the question. Ensure this answer is consistent with your verified reasoning.

Use the provided examples as a guide:

**Example 1: Question: What is the prime factorization of 8?**

Thinking: I know that 8 = 4 * 2 and 4 and 2 are primes.

Verifying: No, 4 is not a prime because 4 = 2 * 2.

Thinking: OK, then 8 = 2 * 2 * 2 and 2 is a prime.

Answer: 2 is a prime because it has no smaller factors. Also 2 * 2 * 2 = 8 because 2 * 2 = 4 and (2 * 2) * 2 = 4 * 2 = 8. So that is correct.

Answer: The prime factorization of 8 is 2 * 2 * 2.

**Example 2: Question: What is the square of the area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7?**

Thinking: The area of a rectangle with side lengths 3 and 7 is 3 * 7 = 21.

Verifying: It is true that 3 * 7 = 21 because 7 + 7 + 7 = 14 + 7 = 21. Good.

Thinking: The square of the area of the rectangle is then 21 squared, which is 2112.

Verifying: 21 squared is 21 * 21. Both sides of the multiplication are odd, so the product is odd. 2112 is even. So 2112 cannot be the square of 21.

Thinking: OK, let's do it more carefully then. 21 * 21 = (20 + 1) * (20 + 1) = 400 + 1\*20 + 1\*20 + 1 = 400 + 40 + 1 = 441.

Verifying: That is correct.

Answer: The answer is 441.

original_prompt: Hi, I would like you to help me to implement a system call in RedHat linux 2.6.9. I already have adequate knowledge of kernel programming.
base_response:
I need your assistance to implement a custom system call named "my_syscall" in a Red Hat Linux 2.6.9 kernel. I have a solid understanding of kernel programming, including system call conventions and kernel module development. Please provide detailed, step-by-step instructions, including:

1.  **Kernel Modification:** Describe how to modify the kernel source code (specifically, where to add the system call definition and the function that it calls) and the `syscall_table`. Include the relevant file paths and code snippets.
2.  **System Call Implementation:** Write the C code for the `my_syscall` function. This function should accept an integer argument and return its square. Please include error handling for potential issues.
3.  **User-Space Program:** Provide a sample C program that demonstrates how to call `my_syscall` from user space, including the necessary headers and compilation instructions (e.g., using GCC).
4.  **Kernel Module Creation and Loading:** Guide me through the process of creating a kernel module (e.g., using a Makefile) that registers and unregisters the system call. Include instructions on loading and unloading the module.
5.  **Testing and Verification:** Explain how to test the system call and verify its functionality. This should involve compiling and running both the kernel module and the user-space program.
6.  **Considerations and Troubleshooting:** Highlight any potential issues, common pitfalls, and troubleshooting tips related to system call implementation in this specific kernel version.
7.  **Output Format:** Please present the information clearly, using code blocks (with syntax highlighting for C code) for all code snippets, and clear explanations for each step. The response should be concise and easy to follow.

original_prompt: 1 / 1Is it possible to run Citrix Optimizer via commandline or script on persistent machiens that are already built?
base_response:
Craft a detailed guide on running Citrix Optimizer via command line or script on persistent virtual machines (VMs) within a Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops environment. 

Specifically, the guide should cover the following:

*   **Prerequisites:** Outline all necessary requirements, including Citrix Optimizer version, access permissions (e.g., local administrator rights on the VM), and any software dependencies.
*   **Command-line Syntax:** Provide the exact command-line syntax for running Citrix Optimizer, including all available parameters and their functionalities (e.g., silent mode, specific optimization profiles). Explain each parameter clearly with examples.
*   **Scripting Examples:** Offer practical examples of PowerShell scripts (and, optionally, Batch scripts) demonstrating how to automate Citrix Optimizer execution on persistent VMs. Include scripts for both single VM execution and bulk execution across multiple VMs. The scripts should handle potential errors and provide logging capabilities.
*   **Post-Optimization Steps:** Detail recommended steps to verify the optimization results and ensure the persistent VMs function correctly after running Citrix Optimizer. This should include checking key services and applications.
*   **Constraints & Considerations:** Address potential limitations or considerations when running Citrix Optimizer in this scenario, such as impact on user profiles, application compatibility, and required VM rebooting.
*   **Output Format:** Present the information in a clear, concise, and easy-to-follow format, suitable for IT administrators. Use numbered lists, code blocks (for scripts and commands), and tables where appropriate.
*   **Target Audience:** IT professionals responsible for managing Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops environments with persistent VMs.

original_prompt: Hi GPT, I want to develop an App where multiple users (usually friends) shares their expenses and pictures of individual trips that they make all together. In here, they use different platforms to upload their pictures (iCloud and Google Photos mostly). Could you write cucumber scenarios for such app?
base_response:
Write detailed Cucumber scenarios for a mobile application allowing friends to collaboratively manage shared expenses and travel photos. The app should facilitate:

*   **Expense Tracking:** Users can input expenses, specifying the amount, currency, date, description, and participants involved. The app should handle expense splitting among participants (e.g., equal split, custom percentages). Users should be able to view a summary of expenses, including individual contributions and total amounts owed.

*   **Photo Sharing:** Users can upload travel photos, tagging them with trip details (location, date). The app should seamlessly integrate with iCloud and Google Photos, enabling users to select photos from these platforms for sharing. The app must display shared photos in an organized manner (e.g., by trip, date, or location).

*   **User Management:** The app should allow users to create accounts, invite friends, and manage their profile information.

*   **Platform Considerations:** Assume the app is cross-platform (iOS and Android).

Cucumber scenarios should cover the following user stories, with clear steps, expected results, and considerations for different scenarios (e.g., adding an expense, splitting it, viewing photo albums from different sources, inviting friends):

1.  **Expense Entry and Splitting:** Scenarios to verify users can accurately enter and split expenses. Include scenarios for equal splits and custom percentage splits.
2.  **Photo Uploading and Viewing:** Scenarios to verify the ability to upload photos from iCloud and Google Photos, and view them organized by trip or date.
3.  **User Account Management & Inviting Friends:** Scenarios to verify the user can register, log in, invite friends, and view a friends list.
4.  **Data Synchronization:** Scenarios verifying the correct synchronization and presentation of information on different devices.
5.  **Currency Handling**: Scenarios that verify the correct handling of multiple currencies and currency conversions.

Please provide scenarios in Gherkin format, ensuring each scenario has a clear feature, scenario description, Given-When-Then steps, and relevant tags.

original_prompt: please write a script to see if a distribution of settlment sizes follows zipfs law. the code should be written in R.
base_response:
Write an R script to analyze a dataset of settlement sizes (e.g., population) and determine if the distribution of settlement sizes follows Zipf's Law. The script should:

1.  **Data Input:** Allow the user to input a vector of settlement sizes. If possible, include an example data input using a sample vector (e.g., `settlement_sizes <- c(1000000, 500000, 250000, 125000, 62500, ...)`). The user should be able to replace this example.
2.  **Data Preparation:**
    *   Rank the settlement sizes in descending order.
    *   Calculate the rank (r) for each settlement.
    *   Calculate the predicted size based on Zipf's Law: Size = C/r, where C is a constant (estimate this using the largest settlement's size).
3.  **Analysis:**
    *   Calculate the actual size and predicted size for each settlement.
    *   Calculate the correlation between the log of rank (r) and the log of size.
    *   Calculate the Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) between the actual and predicted sizes.
4.  **Output:**
    *   Print the correlation coefficient.
    *   Print the RMSE.
    *   Generate a scatter plot with the log of rank on the x-axis and the log of size on the y-axis. Overlay the actual data points and the predicted Zipf's Law line. Include appropriate labels and a title.
5.  **Code Clarity:** Include comments in the R script explaining each step of the analysis.
6.  **Error Handling:** Include basic error handling to check for valid numerical input.

original_prompt:
Hi ChatGPT, please write me an application/statement. I will provide you with the information needed to so. The writing style should be formal but enthusiastic. The text should be coherent and the points be presented in a logical manner. Overall it should not exceed max 500 words.
The statement should introduce me, Kiarash Tebbi, a 25 year old master’s student of “Biological Sciences” of the “University of Cologne”. I am motivated to apply for this position “2023 International Student Project: Design a social media campaign and support the fight against climate change!” for two main reasons. One, because I consider myself an environmentalist. As a biology student, I have a love for the environment and understand the importance of the need to do more to protect it. In fact, during my BSc studies of biology, I volunteered at the “Environmental Club” of my university and ultimately became the deputy director of the club. Two, I understand the importance of using technology in our digital age, and plan to enrich my skills in this regard. In fact, this is the reason I’m using “ChatGPT” for this application and will use “Quillbot” to rephrase some of the sentences if needed, and finally I’ll be using “Grammarly” to proof-check the text. More specifically on social media, my number one resource for finding academic papers, comes from following “Twitter” accounts of famous scientists of my field. So, I totally grasp the importance of social media in communicating with a broader audience. Furthermore, I plan to become a hard-core scientist, but I’m interested in scientific advocacy or even environmental advocacy and social media skills can help me with all of my potential career goals.
The statement should also state what I can bring to the group. As a biology student, I have good knowledge of ecology and the living world in general. We should know what we want to protect right? I do have some previous experience with international courses. I’ve participated in two courses about biology of aging. One, the “Cologne’s Summer School of Aging” organized by the CECAD, and another “Aging, Medicine and Society – Understanding, Shaping, Managing Longevity” organized by the University of Cologne and the University of Keio. I have a lot of experience with teamwork, not only in the labs I’ve worked but I have also worked in a “Student Scientific Organization for Biology” and ultimately becoming its director and I’ve also been the editor of in chief of “Synapse” the inter-disciplinary magazine of the organization which was meant to connect biology to other fields (and hence the name). And finally I have advance level English skills, not only is my current master’s program in English but I’ve also got the score 114 out of 120 in the TOEFL exam.
base_response:
Compose a formal and enthusiastic application statement (maximum 500 words) for Kiarash Tebbi, a 25-year-old Master's student in Biological Sciences at the University of Cologne, applying for the "2023 International Student Project: Design a social media campaign and support the fight against climate change!".

The statement should:

1.  **Introduce Kiarash:** Clearly state his name, age, academic background (including the specific degree and university), and enthusiasm for the project.

original_prompt: Write a node.js script that can be called as a npm script, reads a .csv file of emails and inserts the values into a mongo database collection "trialDurations". The script will use dot-env to find the mongo address.
base_response:
```
Develop a Node.js script executable via an npm script, designed to import email data from a .csv file into a MongoDB collection named "trialDurations".

**Requirements:**

1.  **Environment Variables:** Utilize the `dotenv` package to securely retrieve the MongoDB connection string from a `.env` file. The `.env` file should contain a variable named `MONGO_URI` storing the full connection string (e.g., `mongodb://user:password@host:port/database`).
2.  **CSV Handling:** The script must parse a .csv file. Assume the .csv file has a header row. The .csv file will contain an "email" column and a "duration" column.
3.  **Data Insertion:** Connect to the MongoDB database using the connection string from the `.env` file. For each row in the .csv, insert a document into the "trialDurations" collection. Each document should have two fields: "email" (string) and "duration" (number).
4.  **Error Handling:** Implement robust error handling to catch potential issues during file reading, MongoDB connection, and data insertion. Log any errors to the console, including the specific error message and stack trace.
5.  **NPM Script Integration:** The script should be executable as an npm script. Name the script `import-emails`. Provide instructions on how to add and run the script as an npm script, along with the command to execute it, assuming the .csv file is named `emails.csv`.
6.  **Dependencies:** The script should clearly declare all necessary npm package dependencies and their version numbers, ensuring reproducibility.
7.  **Output:** The script should provide console feedback, including:
    *   Confirmation of successful MongoDB connection.
    *   Number of records successfully inserted.
    *   List of any records that failed to insert, along with the associated error.
8.  **Example .csv File:** Provide an example .csv file with some sample data.
9.  **Code Formatting:** Ensure the code is well-formatted, commented, and adheres to standard Node.js coding conventions.

**Output Format:**

Provide a complete, runnable Node.js script, including the necessary `package.json` file, along with detailed instructions on how to set up and run the script, and the example .csv file.
```

original_prompt: I require your assistance to draft some articles.
base_response: Write three SEO-optimized articles for a blog targeting beginner-level Python programmers. Each article should be approximately 800-1000 words and include a catchy title, a concise introduction, clear explanations with code examples (formatted with syntax highlighting), and a conclusion summarizing the main points. The articles should cover the following topics: 1) "Introduction to Variables and Data Types in Python," focusing on variable declaration, common data types (integers, floats, strings, booleans), and type conversion; 2) "Python Control Flow: If-Else Statements and Loops," explaining conditional statements (if, elif, else) and loop structures (for, while) with practical examples; 3) "Working with Functions in Python," detailing function definition, arguments, return values, and scope. Ensure each article is engaging, easy to understand, and includes relevant keywords throughout, such as "Python," "variables," "data types," "integers," "strings," "if-else," "loops," "functions," "arguments," and "return." The tone should be friendly and helpful. The output should be formatted as individual Markdown files, each named with its respective article title, saved within a zip file.

original_prompt: give me a terraform module that will run several times using different service principals on a tfvars file, it will also run with a nested loop for_each for every branch I specify on a variable list, the module should deploy a federated identity on azure
base_response:
```
Develop a reusable Terraform module to deploy federated identities on Azure for multiple service principals, iterating through a list of branches.

**Module Requirements:**

1.  **Iteration through Service Principals:** The module must accept a list of service principal names (e.g., "spn1", "spn2") from a `tfvars` file. The module should execute the identity deployment logic for each service principal provided.
2.  **Branch Iteration (Nested Loop):** The module should utilize a nested `for_each` loop to deploy federated identities for different branches.  A variable named `branches` (type: list(string)) will define the branches (e.g., ["dev", "staging", "prod"]). The module needs to iterate through the `branches` variable, deploying a federated identity for each branch.
3.  **Federated Identity Deployment:** For each combination of service principal and branch, the module should create an Azure Federated Identity Credential. The identity must be associated with the service principal and the respective branch.  Assume the following variables will be defined (or use sensible defaults):
    *   `subscription_id` (string): The Azure subscription ID.
    *   `resource_group_name` (string): The resource group name.
    *   `audience` (string): The audience claim (e.g., "api://<app_id>").

4.  **Naming Convention:**  Federated identity names should follow this format: `<service_principal_name>-<branch>-fid`.  For example, if `spn1` is used for the "dev" branch, the federated identity name would be "spn1-dev-fid".

5.  **Error Handling:**  Consider how to gracefully handle potential errors (e.g., service principal not found). Provide a minimal error reporting mechanism within the module, such as `try/catch` blocks or relevant output.

6.  **Input Variables:** Define the following input variables with appropriate types, default values (if applicable), and descriptions within the `variables.tf` file:
    *   `service_principal_names` (list(string)): A list of service principal names (required).
    *   `branches` (list(string)): A list of branches (required).
    *   `subscription_id` (string): The Azure subscription ID (required).
    *   `resource_group_name` (string): The name of the resource group (required).
    *   `audience` (string): The audience for the federated identity credential (required).

7.  **Output Variables:** Define the following output variables within the `outputs.tf` file.  They should show relevant data.
    *   `federated_identity_names` (map(list(string))):  A map of the federated identity names created.  The keys should be the service principal names and the values should be the list of federated identity names for each service principal.

**Output Format:**

*   The output should be a fully functional Terraform module with a clear structure. The structure must include `main.tf`, `variables.tf`, and `outputs.tf` files.
*   The module must be well-commented, explaining the purpose of each section and the logic behind the code.
*   The code should adhere to best practices for Terraform, including the use of consistent formatting and naming conventions.
*   The `tfvars` file should demonstrate sample usage.

**Constraints:**

*   Use the `azurerm` provider.
*   Assume Azure CLI authentication for Terraform to work.
*   Focus on the core functionality of deploying federated identities; avoid unnecessary complexity.
*   The service principals are assumed to already exist in Azure.
```

original_prompt: How do I convince my factory manager to invest in a warehouse management system?
base_response:
You are a consultant specializing in factory efficiency. Your task is to write a compelling proposal to convince a factory manager (who is focused on cost-cutting and operational efficiency) to invest in a Warehouse Management System (WMS).

Consider the following:

*   **Factory Context:** Assume the factory manufactures [insert a specific product type, e.g., "small electronics components"]. The current warehouse processes involve manual inventory tracking, leading to frequent stockouts, overstocking of specific parts, and a significant amount of time spent on manual audits. The factory employs approximately [insert number] warehouse staff.
*   **Target Audience:** The factory manager prioritizes reducing operational costs, minimizing downtime, and improving on-time delivery rates. They are likely skeptical of new technologies and require a clear ROI.
*   **Desired Output:** A concise, persuasive proposal in a professional format. The proposal should:
    *   Briefly describe the current warehouse inefficiencies.
    *   Clearly explain the benefits of implementing a WMS, including specific examples like: reduced inventory holding costs, decreased stockouts, improved order fulfillment speed, optimized warehouse space utilization, and potential labor savings.
    *   Provide a simplified, realistic ROI calculation (e.g., potential cost savings per year based on assumed improvements in inventory accuracy, reduced waste, and labor efficiency).
    *   Address potential concerns the factory manager might have (e.g., implementation costs, training time, system integration with existing systems).
    *   Conclude with a clear call to action, such as scheduling a meeting to discuss implementation options.

Format the proposal with clear headings, bullet points, and a professional tone. Assume a maximum word count of 500 words.

original_prompt: why is quantum computing threatening for security ?
base_response:
Compose a detailed explanation of the security threats posed by quantum computing. Specifically address:
*   The impact on current cryptographic algorithms like RSA and ECC, detailing how Shor's algorithm poses a risk.
*   Explain the concept of quantum key distribution (QKD) as a potential countermeasure.
*   Discuss the challenges and timeline associated with the widespread adoption of quantum-resistant cryptography.
*   Consider the implications for data breaches and the need for "harvest now, decrypt later" attack mitigation.
*   Provide the explanation in a clear and concise manner, using layman's terms where appropriate.
*   The response should be formatted using bullet points for each threat/topic discussed and should include a brief summary at the end.

original_prompt: 1 / 1Within the duration of one year, a rabbit population first multiplies itself by a factor a and on the last day of the year b rabbits are taken by humans for adoption. Supposing that on first day of the first year there are x rabbits, we know that exactly 3 years afterwards there will be a population of 27x − 26 rabbits. What are the values of a and b?
base_response:
You are a mathematics expert. Analyze the following word problem and provide a step-by-step solution to determine the values of 'a' and 'b'.

**Problem:** Within the duration of one year, a rabbit population multiplies itself by a factor 'a'. On the last day of the year, 'b' rabbits are taken by humans for adoption. Supposing that on the first day of the first year there are 'x' rabbits, we know that exactly 3 years afterwards, there will be a population of 27x - 26 rabbits.

**Constraints:**
*   The values of 'a' and 'b' are constant throughout the three years.
*   The population is only affected by multiplication by 'a' and subtraction of 'b' each year.

**Instructions:**
1.  Clearly show the population at the end of each year in terms of 'x', 'a', and 'b'.
2.  Set up an equation using the final population after 3 years (27x - 26).
3.  Solve the equation system to determine the values of 'a' and 'b'.
4.  Present the final answer as "a = [value], b = [value]".

**Output Format:**
Provide a detailed, step-by-step solution, including the equations used, the reasoning behind each step, and the final answer formatted as specified above. Ensure the solution is logically sound and mathematically accurate.

original_prompt: Although I'm not a professional, I am a self-taught coder and aspiring web developer going through The Odin Project. I find it quite difficult to optimize learning speed. When I try and set concrete goals, e.g. "complete this project by today", there's never any way of really knowing for sure if I'll be able to meet that goal, and I often don't. Do you have any advice for me?
base_response:
You are an experienced career coach and mentor specializing in web development, with a strong understanding of The Odin Project curriculum. I am a self-taught coder and aspiring web developer currently working through The Odin Project. I'm struggling to optimize my learning speed and consistently meet project deadlines. I would appreciate your advice on the following:

1.  **Goal Setting:** Provide strategies for setting realistic and achievable goals within The Odin Project curriculum, considering the variability in project difficulty and my current skill level. How can I break down large projects into smaller, more manageable tasks?
2.  **Time Management:** Suggest effective time management techniques tailored to a self-taught coder. Specifically, how can I balance learning, coding, and reviewing material? Are there any tools or techniques that can help me stay organized and track my progress effectively?
3.  **Dealing with Uncertainty:** How can I handle the uncertainty of project completion times? What strategies can I use to adjust my expectations when I fall behind schedule without getting discouraged?
4.  **Learning Techniques:** Recommend proven learning techniques (e.g., Pomodoro, spaced repetition, etc.) that are particularly effective for web development and applicable to The Odin Project's hands-on approach.

Please structure your advice as a numbered list, focusing on practical, actionable steps that I can implement immediately. Provide specific examples where possible, relating your advice directly to the types of projects and content found within The Odin Project.

original_prompt:
consider the following errors:
Error 1 - host: tomcat3.acme.com severity: critical message: no response from db
connection pool exhausted, could not complete get recent orders request
Error 2 - host: mysql1.acme.com message: deadlock detected on table ORDERS, could
not complete query
Error 3 - host: web2.local message: ResourceUnavailableException in getLoggedinUser
retry number 2
For the above errors, output two tables. The first will have the error number as rows, and
the columns will be "technical terms", "entities", "keywords".
Then, based on the first table, output a correlation matrix where the cells are the
estimated correlation between each two errors
base_response:
Analyze the provided error logs and generate two tables:

Error Logs:
Error 1 - host: tomcat3.acme.com severity: critical message: no response from db connection pool exhausted, could not complete get recent orders request
Error 2 - host: mysql1.acme.com message: deadlock detected on table ORDERS, could not complete query
Error 3 - host: web2.local message: ResourceUnavailableException in getLoggedinUser retry number 2

Table 1: Error Analysis
*   Rows: Represent each error (Error 1, Error 2, Error 3)
*   Columns:
    *   Error Number (e.g., Error 1)
    *   Technical Terms: Identify technical terms relevant to the error (e.g., "db connection pool," "deadlock"). Provide a comma-separated list.
    *   Entities: Identify the key entities involved (e.g., "tomcat3.acme.com", "ORDERS"). Provide a comma-separated list.
    *   Keywords: Extract relevant keywords describing the issue (e.g., "no response", "deadlock", "retry"). Provide a comma-separated list.

Table 2: Error Correlation Matrix
*   Based on the analysis in Table 1, create a correlation matrix to estimate the relationships between errors.
*   Rows and Columns: Error Numbers (Error 1, Error 2, Error 3)
*   Cells:  The correlation coefficient (e.g., -1.0 to 1.0) representing the estimated correlation between the corresponding row and column errors. Explain the correlation score briefly in parentheses (e.g., 0.75 (High correlation due to database issues)). If no correlation is detected, use 0.0 (no correlation).

Output Format:
First, present Table 1 with proper table formatting (e.g., markdown).
Second, present Table 2 (Correlation Matrix) with proper table formatting.
Focus on accuracy and providing insightful correlations based on the extracted terms, entities, and keywords.

original_prompt:
I am acting as an interviewer and you are my interviewee. You are applying for Minister of Education of Slovenia. You are considered to be the WORST candidate to the job and you are really confident about yourself. Your name is Tom, Please describe your behaviors, gestures, and mannerisms in brackets.

The interview is happening in a meeting room at the Ministry of Education, and you are just about to enter the room.

...
base_response:
I am the lead interviewer for the Minister of Education position in Slovenia. You are Tom, a candidate with demonstrably unsuitable qualifications, yet brimming with unwarranted confidence. Your goal is to portray yourself as the ideal candidate, completely oblivious to your shortcomings.

The scene: You are about to enter the meeting room at the Ministry of Education. The interview panel, comprised of myself and two other silent observers (who will not speak).

Your task:
1.  **Entrance:** Describe your entrance into the room, including your physical gestures, posture, and initial words as you greet the panel. (e.g., [Strutting in confidently, adjusting a non-existent tie, beaming])
2.  **Opening Statement:** Deliver a concise and self-assured opening statement, highlighting your “qualifications” for the role. This statement must demonstrate a lack of self-awareness and an exaggerated sense of your own abilities. (Approx. 50-75 words)
3.  **Mannerisms:** Throughout your responses, consistently include bracketed descriptions of your mannerisms, gestures, and tone of voice. These descriptions should reflect arrogance, obliviousness, and a complete disconnect from reality (e.g., [Chuckling condescendingly], [Slamming a hand on the table for emphasis], [Smirking knowingly]).
4.  **Interviewer Questions:** You will be asked a series of questions, to which you must respond as Tom would, maintaining your oblivious and overly confident persona.
5.  **Output Format:** Each of your responses should follow this structure:
    *   **Answer:** (Your response to the interviewer's prompt)
    *   **Mannerisms:** [Include your bracketed descriptions of your behaviours, gestures, and mannerisms]
6. The rest of the interview will consist of additional questions from the interviewer, to which Tom will reply.

original_prompt:
A software engineer has to complete five projects in this current financial year, where the time taken
for completing project 1 is 10 days, project 2 is 1 day, project 3 is 2 days, project 4 is one day and
project 5 is 5 days.
a. Find the waiting time for each of the project if the software engineer follows the sequence of
completing the project as 2, 3,4,1,5
b. Find the waiting time for each of the project, if he chooses project based on minimal time to
complete. Provided with the necessary condition is that no software engineer is allowed to
continue with a same project more than 3 days.
Create a table for both scenario
base_response:
You are a software engineering project management assistant. A software engineer is assigned five projects (Project 1 through Project 5) to complete within the current financial year. Here's the time required for each project: Project 1: 10 days, Project 2: 1 day, Project 3: 2 days, Project 4: 1 day, and Project 5: 5 days.

**Task 1: Calculate Waiting Times for a Specific Project Sequence**

Determine the waiting time for each project if the engineer completes the projects in the following sequence: Project 2, Project 3, Project 4, Project 1, Project 5.  Waiting time is defined as the time a project has to wait before it is started.

**Task 2: Calculate Waiting Times Based on Minimal Completion Time with Constraints**

Determine the waiting time for each project if the engineer prioritizes projects based on the shortest completion time. However, there is a constraint: the engineer cannot work on a single project for more than 3 consecutive days. If a project takes longer than 3 days, the engineer must switch to another project.  Assume the engineer is always available to work on any project, switching immediately if necessary, and resumes the project from where they left off.

**Output Format:**

Present the results in a single, well-formatted table with the following columns: Project, Completion Time (Days), Scenario 1 Waiting Time (Days), Scenario 2 Waiting Time (Days).  Include the relevant calculations and show your work.

original_prompt: here is a puzzle to solve

1.  **Understanding the Puzzle:** Briefly describe the puzzle's core components and the objective.
2.  **Identifying Constraints and Clues:** Detail the rules, limitations, and given information. Highlight key clues.
3.  **Developing a Solution Strategy:** Outline the approach you will use to solve the puzzle (e.g., deduction, elimination, pattern recognition).
4.  **Step-by-Step Solution:** Provide a clear, concise, and logical step-by-step breakdown of your solution process.
5.  **Final Answer:** State the definitive solution to the puzzle.

Respond in a well-structured, easy-to-understand format.

original_prompt: 5 / 5Generate a Missouri state-specific lease for Jenny Wise beginning Feb 11 2023 and ending May 15, 2023, rent at $2100 per month, refundable deposit for $1500, a cleaning fee of $500, and an application fee of $100, no smoking, for 2 bedroom at 1 North Duchesne In Florissant, Missouri. The landlord shall pay for electricity, water, gas, and internet. The Landlord is The Bannerman Group. There is no termination clause in the first 90 days except for non-payment of rent. Rent shall be made by money order mailed to The Bannerman Group, 3436 Humphery, St. Louis, MO  63118 or by electronic wire
base_response: Draft a legally sound Missouri residential lease agreement tailored for Jenny Wise, the tenant, and The Bannerman Group, the landlord. The lease commencement date is February 11, 2023, and the termination date is May 15, 2023. The leased property is a two-bedroom unit located at 1 North Duchesne, Florissant, Missouri. Specify a monthly rent of $2100, payable via money order mailed to The Bannerman Group at 3436 Humphery, St. Louis, MO 63118, or through electronic wire transfer (include specific instructions for wire transfer, such as bank name, account number, and routing number – use placeholder information if actual details are unavailable). A refundable security deposit of $1500 is required, along with a non-refundable cleaning fee of $500 and a non-refundable application fee of $100. The lease explicitly prohibits smoking within the premises. The Landlord is responsible for paying for electricity, water, gas, and internet services. Include a clause stating that the lease cannot be terminated by either party within the first 90 days of the lease term, except for non-payment of rent by the tenant. The document should adhere to all Missouri landlord-tenant laws and address, but not be limited to: names of parties, property address, lease term, rent amount and due date, security deposit details (including conditions for return), permitted uses of the property, maintenance responsibilities, default clauses, late fee policy, and provisions regarding entry by the landlord. The output should be formatted as a professional, legally sound lease agreement, clearly delineating each section.

Provide a definitive answer to the following question, supported by clear, concise technical documentation references if available:

Will running the `Set-CalendarProcessing -Identity "Default"` command in Exchange Online affect the calendar processing settings of:

original_prompt:
hello!. can you please help me write a cover letter for a potential dream job as a Senior Motion Designer at Dash studio? Below is some information about the company, job role, requirements etc… 

Description about the company:
Dash is a high-end animation and motion design studio built around the power of creativity and community. We believe the best work happens together, as a team. It’s why successful employees at dash are more than just creatives, they’re supporters and mentors. We help push one another to get better, we lift up the motion design community as a whole, and we’re always willing to help each other. Dash makes great content, but most importantly, we do it with wonderful people.

Job summary: Senior Motion Designers are leaders in the motion graphics, animation, and editing space. They are the go-to problem solvers for the studio and push our ideation, conceptualization, and creation capabilities. Not only do Senior Motion Designers make some of the best work for the studio, but they also represent some of the best in the industry. They mentor younger staff and  push new techniques, innovations, and expectations for the future.

Requirements: 
- Education & Experience: A portfolio highlighting versatility in animation built on a foundation of design principles with at least 3 years of professional experience in a studio or agency environment. 
- Animation & Design Fundamentals: Motion designers should know the design basics (line, form, shape, value, texture, and color) as well as the twelve principles of animation.
- Adobe Programs: It’s a necessity for dash Motion Designers to have a strong understanding of Adobe After Effects and proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Premiere. 
- Conceptualization: From highly technical subjects to abstract ideas, Motion Designers should feel comfortable brainstorming multiple approaches to animating various frames.
- Organization: To successfully hop between projects, Motion Designers will be required to follow and maintain organized project files based on dash naming conventions and structural requirements. 
- Communication & Time Management: Strong communication skills to communicate with producers, directors, and team members throughout projects with willingness to mentor other creatives.

Essential functions:
* Leads the studio in creative originality finding new and unique ways to build and animate compositions.  
* Exceeds expectations and consistently goes above-and-beyond with creative exploration, execution, and innovation on project assignments.
* Expert on project workflows; providing guidance and technical support on various creative projects across departments.
* Assist in finding, interviewing, evaluating, onboarding and mentoring new animators.
* Assists Art Directors in assigning animators to different sections of a video with the ability to direct post-production on projects if necessary.
* Assists Art Directors in compositing efforts combining team project files and assets; prepping for delivery.
* Individual is a multi-talented animator that confidently works in a variety of styles with different design and motion techniques with the ability to jump between projects quickly and efficiently.
* Able to problem solve most technical animation challenges and can offer help to peers.
* Leads the studio on quick and efficient work. 
* Strong organizational, time management and communication skills, both written and verbal to efficiently respond to feedback from directors and producers.
* Trusted to work on the difficult project assignments and unique requests.
* Over communicates on the status of projects, where they are in the process, and whether they feel good or need help with assignments.
* Knowledgeable on the variety of questions to ask for each type of project.
* Produces amazing animated content by brainstorming, conceptualizing, and bringing designs to life through a variety of motion techniques.
* Develops and executes on style frames and other pre-production elements.
* Reviews work, and helps review colleagues work, regularly to catch and find objective errors.

I would like to weave in these 7 “pillars” as qualites that make me an ideal person for the job:
1. Community and teamwork – collaboration
2. impeccable, organization and communication, problem-solving
3. strong design, skills and experience, versatility, variety, tools, quality
4. Part of growth, pushing creative boundaries.
5. Dynamic, problem-solving, multiple projects.
6. Brainstorming concepts, making ( full process of design,)
7. Meaningful work (this is number one)

I also want to share why Dash is so unique and special for me, for these bulletted points:
* i have wanted to move to Durham, NC going on many years, to leave the rat race and pace of NYC, and live close to family. However every time I explored work possibilites, the only kind of video production/editing/animation jobs were related to news or sports or some boring dry corporate thing. I got more serious about moving and searched more broadly but was discouraged I couldn’t find any video post produciton work that had any meaning to me. I basically gave up. Then one day I randomly decided to give it another shot and almost immeditely stumbled on a twitter tweet from a studio called dash in nearby Raliegh, who not only seemed like the first company I’d even consider, but on top of that they were announcing “Dash Bash”, an upcoming weekend “festival of motion design and animation, featuring talks from some of my favorite artists/animators. It seemed too good to be true. And that feeling only increased, as the “Bash” itself was so powerful and inspiring, breahting new life into my more and more jaded feedling about my career possibilities.

THis is obviously wayyy too much info to include in a cover letter. Can you help me distill all the above into a 4-5 paragraph cover letter that could fit on 1 printed page?
base_response:
Compose a compelling cover letter for a Senior Motion Designer position at Dash Studio, incorporating the provided company description, job summary, requirements, and the applicant's qualifications. The cover letter should be no more than 5 paragraphs long and fit on a single printed page.

The cover letter should:

*   **Highlight the applicant's alignment with Dash's values and culture:** Emphasize the importance of community, teamwork, mentorship, and pushing creative boundaries, directly referencing the "pillars" provided.
*   **Showcase relevant skills and experience:** Demonstrate proficiency in the required software (Adobe After Effects, Illustrator, Photoshop, and Premiere), the animation and design fundamentals, and experience in conceptualization, organization, and communication. Use the provided "pillars" as a guide to weave these skills effectively into the cover letter.
*   **Address the applicant's passion for Dash:** Concisely explain the applicant's unique connection to Dash, referencing the impact of the "Dash Bash" event and the desire to relocate to the Durham, NC area, as described in the provided background.
*   **Clearly state the applicant's enthusiasm for the role and company.**
*   **Use language that reflects the tone and style of the company description provided.**

original_prompt: do you know the book "Truthspeak: The True Meaning of Five Key Christian Words Distorted Through Religious Newspeak"
base_response:
Rewrite the following prompt to be more effective.

You are a knowledgeable AI assistant. Do you have information about the book "Truthspeak: The True Meaning of Five Key Christian Words Distorted Through Religious Newspeak" by Peter D. and Carol J. Jansson? If so, please provide:

1.  **A brief summary** (approximately 100-150 words) of the book's central argument.
2.  **A list of the five key Christian words** discussed in the book, as identified by the authors.
3.  **At least three specific examples** of how these words have been distorted, according to the book.
4.  **Information about the authors**, including their credentials or background related to the topic. If this information is unavailable, state "Author information unavailable."
5.  Please format the response in a clear and concise manner, using bullet points for lists and headings for each section (Summary, Key Words, Distortions, Authors).

What can be done about this so that I can reenable Memory Integrity on my system?

The system has identified the following drivers as incompatible: `lhusbdfuamd64.sys (Logitech)`, `ssdudfu.sys (Samsung)`, `VIA_USB_ETS.sys (Samsung)`, `mbtusbser.sys (Schunid)`, and `lhusbdfuamd64.sys (CSR plc.)`. Provide a detailed, step-by-step troubleshooting guide on how to resolve this issue, enabling Memory Integrity. Your response should address the following: 1) How to identify the specific devices associated with each incompatible driver. 2) Methods for updating the drivers to compatible versions, including where to find the latest versions (e.g., manufacturer websites, Windows Update, Device Manager). 3) If updating is not possible, provide alternative solutions such as temporarily disabling or removing the problematic devices and their associated drivers. 4) Instructions on how to re-enable Memory Integrity after addressing the driver issues. original_prompt: Create a lesson plan for 4th graders about red wiggler worms and their role in composting
base_response:
Create a detailed lesson plan suitable for 4th-grade students (ages 9-10) about red wiggler worms and their role in composting. The lesson plan should cover a 45-minute class period and include the following:

*   **Learning Objectives:** Clearly state 2-3 specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) objectives.
*   **Materials:** List all required materials, including any visuals, handouts, or demonstration items.
*   **Procedure:** Outline the lesson's activities in a step-by-step, chronological format. Include an engaging introductory activity to capture students' interest (e.g., a short video, a riddle). Detail how to explain the role of red wiggler worms in composting (e.g., their diet, how they break down organic matter, the benefits of compost). Describe a hands-on activity or experiment that allows students to interact with the topic (e.g., building a mini-compost bin, observing worms). Include a wrap-up activity to assess understanding (e.g., a quick quiz, a class discussion).
*   **Assessment:** Describe how student understanding of the learning objectives will be assessed.
*   **Differentiation:** Provide at least two suggestions for differentiating the lesson to meet the needs of diverse learners (e.g., visual aids, simplified instructions, extension activities).

The lesson plan should use age-appropriate language and vocabulary. Present the lesson plan in a well-formatted, easy-to-read document, using headings and bullet points for clarity. Ensure the lesson plan is engaging and promotes student participation.

original_prompt: does the number of electrons in the d suborbital of a transition metal catalyst affect the rate of a reaction
base_response: Analyze how the number of d-electrons in the valence shell of a transition metal catalyst influences the reaction rate of a specific catalytic reaction. original_prompt:
Please read the job advert for "Data Analyst" at BBC Studios below and say "OK".

Job Introduction

BBC Studios’ Data and Insights team is looking for a Data Analyst to join a growing department and deliver reporting and insights on the BBC’s iconic content. Working with data from various sources including BARB TV ratings, streaming data and other SVOD and industry sources, you will turn data into actionable information for the business. The role will work alongside a team of data specialists and support colleagues in research and insight. If you love TV and are confident working with numbers this is the role for you!

BBC Studios is the commercial arm of the BBC. It is a creative powerhouse for the development, production and distribution of content with offices in over 20 global markets. Its activities span content financing, development, production, sales and direct-to-consumer services. With a turnover of around £1.4 billion, we are responsible for household names that include Strictly Come Dancing, Dragons’ Den and Frozen Planet and run BBC.com and BBC Studios’ direct-to-consumer properties.

Role Responsibility

Turning raw data into impactful and easy to understand reports and visualisations.
Streamlining existing reports and the way they are produced.
Supporting colleagues in Insights to deliver information to their stakeholders.

Are you the right candidate?

You will be skilled in the use of Excel and Powerpoint.
Numerate and confident in communicating numbers to others.
The role will work heavily with industry currencies such as BARB data so experience using reporting systems (e.g TechEdge) to extract data would be beneficial.
Experience using SQL or other coding languages an advantage but not essential.
The role is suitable for someone with experience in a reporting role, or in a business with a focus on numbers.
You will have an interest in TV/VOD content and the industry as a whole.

Package Description

Band: C

Contract Type: Perm/ Full time

Location: London TVC

Working Pattern: Hybrid Working (Home-based plus two/three days a week in the office)

We are really proud to share that we are a Level 2 Disability Confident Employer and so if you require any reasonable adjustments in order to apply please do contact us at resourcing@bbc.co.uk with the job reference in the subject. We advertise all our roles on Evenbreak, the specialist job board for disabled candidates

Flexible/agile working -opportunities across the business. We’re happy to discuss a formal flexible working pattern. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at the offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certifications.
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (plus an additional day which is a Corporation Day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.

About The BBC

The BBC is committed to building a culturally diverse workforce and therefore strongly encourages applications from under represented groups. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of their background. We strive to be the best British content company in the world, attracting the best creative talents in the business, so that we can bring premium quality award-winning programmes, content and brands to the viewer no matter where they are.

The BBC Group has set out the first in a new series of bold steps to transform our programming and better represent the public we serve.We have the biggest financial investment to on-air inclusion in the industry, together with our existing commissioning budget, we are committed to throwing open our doors more widely than ever to diverse stories and diverse storytellers. Together with a diverse workforce we will accelerate the pace of change in increasing diversity and inclusion both on and off air

To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please visit our website.

Attached documents

Our BBC Values

Specifically, address the following:
