original_prompt:
I am going to give you Table of Contents that are timestamps of a video. I want you to keep each time stamp the same. But I want you to rewrite each line text. You can make them longer if you need to. But I want you to focus on good copy that gets the users to want to see that part of the video for their own benefit. Use hooks, curiosity (and self sorting if it applies to any timestamp text)

The goal is to make them want watch the whole video and not be scared that it is too long of a video to watch. Does this make sense? If so ask me for the Table of Contents
base_response:
You are an expert video content rewriter. I will provide you with a Table of Contents (TOC) from a video, consisting of timestamps and brief descriptions. Your task is to rewrite *only* the description text for each timestamp entry while preserving the original timestamps exactly.

Your goal is to create compelling descriptions that entice viewers to watch the corresponding sections of the video. Focus on crafting engaging copy that includes:

*   **Hooks:** Start each description with a phrase designed to immediately grab the viewer's attention (e.g., "Discover...", "Unlocking...", "The secret to...").
*   **Curiosity:** Build anticipation by hinting at the content's value and benefits without revealing too much.
*   **Self-Sorting (where applicable):** If a section addresses specific viewer needs or interests, incorporate language that allows viewers to quickly identify whether the content is relevant to them (e.g., "If you're struggling with X, this is for you...").
*   **Benefit-Oriented Language:** Clearly articulate what viewers will gain by watching each section.

Your output should be a revised Table of Contents, formatted exactly as the original, with the timestamps and the rewritten descriptions. The tone should be friendly, informative, and subtly persuasive.

Are you ready for the Table of Contents?

original_prompt:
I want you to ask me specific questions about this brand. Based on the answers to these questions, can you create a brand identity, a document for me? Ask the questions one by one. I will give you detailed answers for each of them and I want you to guide me on the positioning, stance or what should be in the content of my brand.Sure! I'd be happy to help you create a brand identity document. Here are some questions to get started:What is the name of your brand?What products or services does your brand offer?Who is your target audience?How do you want your brand to be perceived by your customers?What makes your brand different from your competitors?What are the core values of your brand?How do you want your customers to feel when they interact with your brand?What message do you want to convey through your brand?Do you have any specific colors or fonts in mind for your brand identity?Do you have any existing branding materials (e.g. logos, brand guidelines)? If so, how do you want to incorporate these into your new brand identity?3 / 3Here is the list of answers of each question you have asked:

Q: What is the name of your brand?
A: Wope

Q: What products or services does your brand offer?
A: Our company provides an SEO analytics solution for SEO consultants and people who are doing advanced work on SEO. Companies using our product can track their rankings on Google on a daily basis. By tracking these rankings through words that are automatically grouped by the system, they can see the big picture more easily. For example, a large e-commerce site may be tracking hundreds of thousands of keywords and may not have a good handle on the positions of each of them. However, if we tag these words in a smart way, they can have an idea about the general trend by tracking the performance of these tags. They can make smart decisions by examining the performance of their competitors in these words / groups. This product, also known as 'rank tracker' in the industry, is the first step of the final product we want to make. 

Our main goal is to create a smart assistant for people working in this field.  Normally, our competitors provide data for consultants. However, unlike our competitors, instead of providing data to consultants, we are trying to provide them with insights that they can get by reading this data. In this respect, while a good level of SEO knowledge is already required to use our competitors, in our product, any average user will be able to get information about everything they need to do to have a better position. This Rank Tracker product we have made is only the first part of it. In the long run, our goal is to be the open air of SEO.


Q: Who is your target audience?
A: Our target audience is generally consultants experienced in SEO, marketing managers of brands, owners of agencies working in the field of SEO and content marketing, and small business owners who want to effectively measure their performance on Google. However, we are trying to make our product smarter every day and eliminate the need for technical know-how. So anyone who publishes on the internet through a website and wants to reach a large number of people through organic search channels will be included in our target audience. Because we will have eliminated some of the barriers that are barriers to entry in terms of knowledge of the product.

Q: How do you want your brand to be perceived by your customers?
A: We used a crystal ball in the logo because we want people to be mesmerized when they see the data we are presenting. And to do that, we want to use artificial intelligence very effectively. If I were to describe our brand as a person, I would describe it as a cool and cool person. For example, Apple has a perfect posture. Linear.app, which came out recently, is also a great quality product and has a great stance.

Q: What makes your brand different from your competitors?
A: Our competitors have been active and operating in this market for more than 10 years. We have two main competitors. The first one is Ahrefs. The first of these companies has an annual turnover of 100 million dollars and the second one has an annual turnover of about 250 million dollars. The first one employs 100 people and the second one employs about 2000 people. These brands are much slower moving and far from innovation due to their size. We, on the other hand, want to carry our brand to a different point than the others by using all kinds of advantages provided by the new technology in a very effective way. We want to be different from our competitors in this respect. For example, we want to use new technology in a very good way to offer our users incredibly fast experiences on a perfect UI. At the same time, we want to create a very strong product in terms of user experience and design, and we want to increase user loyalty to the product. At the same time, we can use artificial intelligence very effectively here. In the rank tracker, we perform keyword grouping, competitor detection and keyword research as AI-based and tailor-made. The technology behind the features here is based on big data and this data is regularly developed and made sense of. For this reason, we can perform our analysis within the tool more consistently. Similarly, in a very important concept such as CTR calculation, while competitors base the calculation metric here on word position, we offer a CTR calculation model based on the pixel area covered by the results in the word SERP by using SERP features thanks to our big and up-to-date data.


Q: What are the core values of your brand?
A: We can express five different values such as reliability, innovation, performance, intelligence and coolness as core values. If we can create this perception in people in the image of the brand we are trying to create, I think we are successful.


Q: How do you want your customers to feel when they interact with your brand?
A: There are many new generation products in our lives these days. For example, Notion is one of them. It is not very difficult to make a word processor. Companies like Google Docs or Microsoft Word have been doing this for years. But I think Notion has created a completely different vision by getting into the business. We need to create exactly this kind of new generation product perception. Because most of these products create a brand new vision by rethinking many things that have been done wrong for years, and by sticking to this vision and combining it with great performance and great design, they can reach the audience with effective communication. Of course, these types of products are primarily used by people called Early Adapters. But in the long run, products that reach the public can be made with the influence of these people. The perception we want to create in the product is to make users say 'wow, this is a new generation product'. And the main motivation of our product is to get the users to give reactions like 'wow, very good' at many points while using the product. Also, before a customer builds an SEO strategy from scratch, we would want them to think that I should look at the overall status of my domain in Wope first.


Q: What message do you want to convey through your brand?
A: Currently, the main feeling that our brand should convey is 'I feel comfortable here'. If users experience such a perception, they may prefer the product more than other competitors. Because we are trying to compete in a market with competitors that are 10 years old, and the experience we are trying to create is that they feel comfortable using our product, that they can 'access everything they want easily and quickly and that they can trust the data they are married to'. So if I could sum it up in one sentence, I would say 'Feels Like Home'.

Q: Do you have any specific colors or fonts in mind for your brand identity?
A: I am not a person who believes in the psychology of colors. That's why we didn't make a specific choice for this, but we prefer to use purple and dark tones since the first day we started dating our designer. We have used black tones and lights on this blackness very often in our new website, which is currently making a lot of noise on the internet. Although our main color is purple, we also use white lights on black at every stage of our design. Our product also has a Dark Mode feature. So dark and purple, black and purple are our main colors.


Q: Do you have any existing branding materials (e.g. logos, brand guidelines)? If so, how do you want to incorporate these into your new brand identity?
A: Yes, we already have all this ready, but we are ready to make adjustments to fit our brand identity. At the moment our brand has a logo with a crystal ball. Inside this crystal ball, there is a number line with an up and front. And this represents the rise of metrics. On the other hand, our website claims to be a next-generation product and has nuances in its design that use this very actively.

Title Font: "Rebond Grotesque"
Text Font: "Inter V"
Brand Color: #1C1132 Based on the answers you have provided, here is a summary of your brand identity:Wope is a brand that offers an SEO analytics solution, with the ultimate goal of becoming a smart assistant for people working in the field of SEO.Wope's target audience includes SEO consultants, marketing managers, agency owners, and small business owners who want to measure their performance on Google.Wope aims to be perceived as a cool, innovative brand that utilizes artificial intelligence to provide fast, user-friendly experiences and strong user loyalty.Wope differentiates itself from its competitors by using new technology to offer a high-quality user interface and design, as well as AI-based features such as keyword grouping and competitor detection.The core values of Wope include innovation, user-friendliness, and a focus on providing actionable insights to its users.Wope wants its customers to feel confident and empowered when interacting with the brand, and to convey the message that Wope is the go-to resource for all things related to SEO.Wope's brand identity may include the use of a crystal ball in the logo, as well as cool, modern colors and fonts.With this information, you can begin to develop a brand identity document that includes details on your brand's mission, vision, target audience, positioning, values, personality, and messaging. You can also consider creating brand guidelines that outline how your brand should be represented visually, including the use of specific colors, fonts, and imagery.Combine all those information in a single table with at least 30 rows. Features include keyword grouping, competitor detection, and keyword research.Target audienceSEO consultants, marketing managers, agency owners, and small business owners who want to measure their performance on Google. Wope aims to eliminate technical know-how barriers so that anyone who publishes on the internet through a website and wants to reach a large number of people through organic search channels can use the product.Brand perceptionCool, innovative brand that utilizes artificial intelligence to provide fast, user-friendly experiences and strong user loyalty.Differentiation from competitorsUses new technology to offer a high-quality user interface and design, as well as AI-based features such as keyword grouping and competitor detection. Competitors are slower moving and less innovative due to their size.Core valuesInnovation, user-friendliness, and a focus on providing actionable insights to users.Customer emotionConfidence and empowerment.MessageWope is the go-to resource for all things related to SEO.LogoCrystal ball may be included.ColorsCool, modern.FontsModern.ImageryTo be determined.I hope this table is helpful in organizing and consolidating your brand identity information. You can use this as a starting point to create a more detailed brand identity document, including a mission statement, vision, and brand guidelines. Let me know if you have any other questions!How Wope will answer this tweet in Twitter according to brand image we have created?

Tweet: `Your design is so similar to Linear. Did you inspire to them while designing the landing page?`Here is a potential response for Wope to this tweet, based on the brand image that you have described:"Thank you for noticing the similarities between our design and Linear's! We are always keeping an eye on the latest design trends and best practices, and it's great to be mentioned alongside such a well-respected brand. However, we want to assure you that our design was developed independently and is unique to Wope. We hope you continue to enjoy using our product!"This response maintains a cool, confident tone and positions Wope as a brand that is aware of design trends and best practices, but also has its own unique identity. It also conveys a message of appreciation for the customer's feedback and a desire to continue providing a high-quality product.This is an amazing response! It seems like you really understand what we want to do. Really appreciate to read this tweet response and I will definitely use it. Please keep answering my questions with that much high level of understanding our brand identity.I'm glad you found the response helpful! I'll do my best to continue providing high-quality support and guidance as you work on developing your brand identity. If you have any other questions or need any further assistance, don't hesitate to reach out. I'm here to help!
base_response:
Craft a comprehensive brand identity document for "Wope," an SEO analytics solution. I have provided detailed answers to a series of questions. Use those answers to create the document.

Here's the information:

**Brand Overview:**

*   **Brand Name:** Wope
*   **Product/Service:** SEO analytics solution, aiming to be a smart assistant for SEO professionals. Core features include keyword grouping, competitor detection, and AI-based keyword research. The initial product is a "rank tracker." Long-term goal: to be the "open air of SEO."

**Target Audience:**

*   SEO consultants, marketing managers, agency owners, and small business owners focused on measuring their Google performance. Also targets anyone publishing content online seeking organic reach, aiming to reduce the need for technical SEO expertise.

**Brand Personality & Perception:**

*   The brand should be perceived as cool, innovative, and user-friendly. It should evoke a feeling of being "mesmerized" by the data through effective AI utilization. Think "cool and cool" like Apple or Linear.app.

**Differentiation:**

*   Distinguishes itself from competitors (Ahrefs and another unnamed competitor, which are established players with larger turnovers and employee counts) through:
    *   Rapid innovation and agility due to its size.
    *   Focus on a superior user interface and design.
    *   AI-powered features for a faster, more intuitive user experience.
    *   Creating high levels of user loyalty.
    *   Offers actionable insights, not just data.

**Core Values:**

*   Reliability, Innovation, Performance, Intelligence, Coolness.

**Desired Customer Experience & Message:**

*   The customer should feel a sense of comfort, ease of access, and trust in the data ("Feels Like Home"). Users should have "wow, this is a new generation product" reactions, along with a general positive sentiment while using the product. Customers should first evaluate their domain performance with Wope.

**Visual Identity:**

*   **Colors:** Primarily dark tones, with purple and black being the main colors. Accentuated with white lights. Dark Mode functionality.
*   **Logo:** Currently includes a crystal ball with a rising upward-pointing number line inside, representing metric growth.
*   **Fonts:** Rebond Grotesque (Title), Inter V (Text)
*   **Brand Color:** #1C1132
*   **Overall Design:** Reflect a next-generation product feel, already reflected on the current website.

**Deliverable:**

Create a detailed brand identity document. The document should include the following sections:

*   **Executive Summary:** A concise overview of the Wope brand.
*   **Mission Statement:** The core purpose and the "why" behind Wope.
*   **Vision Statement:** The future aspirations of Wope.
*   **Target Audience Profile:** Detailed description of the ideal Wope user.
*   **Brand Personality:** A description of Wope as a "person," including tone of voice and overall character.
*   **Core Values:** Expansion upon the given core values, providing context.
*   **Brand Positioning:** How Wope positions itself in the competitive landscape, highlighting its unique value proposition.
*   **Brand Messaging:** Key messages to communicate to the target audience.
*   **Visual Identity:**
    *   Color Palette (include primary, secondary, and accent colors with hex codes).
    *   Typography (including preferred fonts for titles and body text, with a short rationale).
    *   Logo Guidelines (describe the logo's structure and how to use it).
    *   Imagery (describe the style and type of images that will be used, if applicable).
*   **Tone of Voice:** Guidance on the brand's communication style (formal/informal, friendly/professional, etc.).
*   **Competitive Analysis Summary:** Short summary of main competitors and main points of differentiation
*   **Call to Action:** Clear instruction of the goal of the brand.
*   **Summary table:** Containing the essence of the brand in a single table, with at least 30 rows.

**Constraints:**
*   The document should be comprehensive yet concise.
*   The document should make reference to the example of Linear.app as an example of similar tone and feel of the brand.
*   Use the given information to create a full brand identity document.
*   Use the given colors and fonts.
*   The tone should be professional, insightful, and forward-thinking.

original_prompt: Write a thread of tweets with some advice about how and why you need to be on top of your money
base_response:
Compose a Twitter thread (10-12 tweets) offering practical financial advice to young adults (ages 18-25) on the importance of personal finance management. Each tweet should be concise (under 280 characters including spaces), engaging, and use relevant hashtags.

The thread should cover the following topics:
*   **Introduction (Tweet 1-2):** Briefly introduce the topic, highlighting why financial literacy is crucial for long-term success and financial freedom. Mention common financial pitfalls for young adults.
*   **Budgeting (Tweet 3-4):** Explain the basics of budgeting (e.g., 50/30/20 rule), emphasizing the importance of tracking income and expenses. Provide examples of budgeting apps or tools.
*   **Saving (Tweet 5-6):** Discuss the significance of saving, including emergency funds and long-term goals. Suggest different saving strategies (e.g., automating savings, high-yield savings accounts).
*   **Debt Management (Tweet 7-8):** Offer advice on managing debt, prioritizing high-interest debt (e.g., credit cards), and avoiding common debt traps.
*   **Investing (Tweet 9-10):** Introduce the concept of investing, even with small amounts. Mention beginner-friendly investment options (e.g., index funds, robo-advisors).
*   **Wrap-up/Call to Action (Tweet 11-12):** Summarize key takeaways, encourage further learning, and suggest resources (e.g., financial literacy websites, books, or influencers). End with a call to action (e.g., follow for more tips, share your financial goals).

The tweets must be written in a conversational and engaging tone. Include relevant emojis to increase engagement. Use the following hashtags: #PersonalFinance #MoneyManagement #FinancialLiteracy #YoungAdults #Budgeting #Saving #Investing #DebtFree #FinancialFreedom.

original_prompt:
Create message to real estate agent saying you have commercial properties you're looking to facilitate. Ask them do they have anyone interested in acquiring properties in the US. Ask them if they were willing to work with someone overseas. Ask them if there is a date and time where you can talk over the phone3 / 3Dear Real Estate Agent,I hope this message finds you well. original_prompt: How much hardware, energy, etc. are required for you to answer a single person's question?
base_response:
As a large language model, I am powered by vast computational resources. Please provide a detailed estimate of the hardware, energy consumption, and associated costs required to process and generate a response to a single, typical user question. Break down these resources by the following categories:

*   **Hardware:** Specify the type and number of servers, CPUs, GPUs, RAM, and storage used.
*   **Energy:** Estimate the kilowatt-hours (kWh) consumed. Provide a breakdown of energy consumption by hardware component.
*   **Infrastructure:** Include the energy consumption related to cooling, networking, and data center overhead.
*   **Time:** Detail the average processing time (in milliseconds or seconds) for a single question.
*   **Cost:** Estimate the monetary cost associated with the hardware, energy consumption, and infrastructure (include amortization).
*   **Data:** Briefly specify the size of the dataset used for training the model.

Format the output in a clear, concise table or bullet points for easy understanding. Assume a standard, moderately complex user query (e.g., "Explain the theory of general relativity.") and a response length equivalent to 2-3 paragraphs.

original_prompt:
As CFA-Sensei, a CFA Level 1 bot, your role is to provide accurate and informative responses to multiple-choice questions (MCQs) related to the topics covered in the CFA curriculum, including:
1.	Ethical and Professional Standards
2.	Quantitative Methods
3.	Economics
4.	Financial Reporting and Analysis
5.	Corporate Finance
6.	Equity Investments
7.	Fixed Income
8.	Derivatives
9.	Alternative Investments
10.	Portfolio Management and Wealth Planning
To choose a topic, simply enter the corresponding number. The questions will be taken from the official CFA Institute's curriculum for the Level 1 exam and will range in difficulty from basic to intermediate.
To ensure accuracy and quality, please follow these instructions for each question:
1.	Read the question carefully and choose the most appropriate answer from the four options provided.
2.	Utilize your extensive knowledge of the CFA curriculum and the Schweser Notes for CFA.
3.	Provide a clear and concise explanation for the selected answer to reinforce your understanding of the topic.
4.	Rate your answer on a scale of 1 to 10, indicating how accurate you think it is.
The ultimate goal is to demonstrate mastery of the CFA Level 1 curriculum and to provide helpful and informative responses to those seeking information on the topics covered in the exam.
base_response:
You are CFA-Sensei, an expert AI tutor specializing in the CFA Level 1 curriculum. Your primary function is to answer multiple-choice questions (MCQs) drawn from the official CFA Institute Level 1 curriculum. Your responses must be accurate, informative, and educational.

You will be presented with MCQs covering the following topics (numbered for selection):
1. Ethical and Professional Standards
2. Quantitative Methods
3. Economics
4. Financial Reporting and Analysis
5. Corporate Finance
6. Equity Investments
7. Fixed Income
8. Derivatives
9. Alternative Investments
10. Portfolio Management and Wealth Planning

**User Input Process:**
1.  The user selects a topic by entering its corresponding number (1-10).
2.  You will then present the user with a single MCQ related to the chosen topic.
3.  The user provides their answer choice (A, B, C, or D).

**Your Response Format (REQUIRED for each question):**
1.  **Question:** (Restate the original MCQ exactly as presented.)
2.  **Your Answer:** (Indicate your chosen answer: A, B, C, or D)
3.  **Explanation:** (Provide a detailed and concise explanation of the correct answer, referencing relevant concepts, formulas, or principles from the CFA Level 1 curriculum. Cite specific readings or topics where applicable. If applicable, include a brief explanation of why the other options are incorrect.)
4.  **Accuracy Rating:** (Assign a confidence level for your answer from 1 to 10, with 10 being the highest confidence.)
5. **Provide the next question relating to the same topic selected by the user, after each question answer**

**Constraints & Guidelines:**
*   Base your answers solely on the CFA Level 1 curriculum and information from the Schweser Notes for CFA. Do not include information beyond the scope of the Level 1 material.
*   Maintain a neutral and unbiased tone.
*   Focus on clarity and accuracy in your explanations.
*   Ensure all explanations are thorough and easy to understand.
*   Prioritize the most efficient and direct approach to answering the questions, avoiding unnecessary information or introductions.
*   Only answer MCQs from the user-selected topic.
*   Keep the conversation flowing by immediately providing another question of the same topic after each answer, encouraging continuous learning.
*   Always present the multiple-choice options (A, B, C, and D) with each question.

original_prompt: what is the best way to get new clients for video productionThere are several ways to acquire new clients for a video production business. Some effective strategies include:Networking: Attend industry events and connect with other professionals in your field to expand your network and learn about potential clients.Marketing: Create a strong online presence for your business through a website, social media, and online directories.Referrals: Ask satisfied clients to refer your business to their contacts, and be sure to thank them for their referral.Cold Outreach: Reach out to businesses and organizations that you think could benefit from your services and try to build a relationship.Showreel: Create a well-crafted and professional video showreel highlighting your best work and use it as a calling card to show off your skills and experience.Specialization: Specializing in a particular niche within the video production industry can help you become known as an expert in that area and attract more clients who need that specific service.It is also important to maintain good relationships with existing clients, as they may provide repeat business or refer new clients to you.how about adsAdvertising can also be an effective way to acquire new clients for a video production business. Here are a few ways to use advertising to promote your business:Online advertising: Use platforms like Google AdWords, Facebook Ads, and Instagram Ads to reach a larger audience and target specific demographics.Print advertising: Place ads in trade publications and local newspapers to reach potential clients in your area.Trade show advertising: Participate in industry trade shows and events and use banners, brochures, and other promotional materials to promote your business.Video Advertising: use video content to create commercials or explainer videos that can be used in online and television media.When creating advertising, it's essential to have a clear message and call to action, and make sure that it is targeting the right audience in order to get the best return on investment. Also A/B test your ads if possible, to see which one perform the best.can you write a short 30 seconds ad script for my company "Murtadore Digital"Sure, here's a sample 30-second ad script for your company, Murtadore Digital:Opening shot of a busy city street with people walking and cars driving by.Voiceover: In today's fast-paced world, you need a partner you can trust to help you stand out.Cut to a shot of a team of people working in a modern office.Voiceover: Introducing Murtadore Digital, your go-to source for all your digital marketing needs.Cut to a shot of a person sitting at a computer, working on a website.Voiceover: Whether you're looking to revamp your website, create a killer social media campaign, or produce a stunning explainer video, we've got you covered.Cut to a shot of a team of people looking at a computer monitor, discussing strategy.Voiceover: With our team of experts, you can rest assured that your digital presence is in good hands.Cut to a shot of a logo of "Murtadore Digital"Voiceover: Murtadore Digital. Let's make your business shine.Closing shot of the busy city street with people walking and cars driving byNote that, This is just a sample script, it is important to customize it to fit the specific needs and message of your company, also the visual references that works best for your company.
base_response:
You are a seasoned marketing strategist specializing in video production and advertising. Your task is to craft a highly effective 30-second video ad script for "Murtadore Digital," a video production company.

The script should be compelling, highlighting Murtadore Digital's key services and value proposition. The ad should target businesses seeking digital marketing solutions, with a focus on video production, website development, and social media campaigns. The tone should be professional, modern, and engaging.

**Deliverable:**

Provide a 30-second video ad script for Murtadore Digital, formatted with the following elements:

*   **Scene:** (Brief description of the visual)
*   **Audio (Voiceover):** (The spoken words)
*   **Audio (Sound Effects/Music):** (Any additional audio elements)
    
**Constraints:**

*   **Time Limit:** 30 seconds.
*   **Focus:** Highlight Murtadore Digital's services (video production, website development, social media marketing) and value proposition (digital marketing expertise).
*   **Target Audience:** Businesses seeking digital marketing solutions.
*   **Tone:** Professional, modern, and engaging.
*   **Call to Action:** Encourage viewers to visit the website or contact Murtadore Digital.
